properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 6 at 9:35AM PST until January 9 at 12:51PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County


The heavy rain that started overnight will continue at times today
and drive the Skokomish River above flood stage this afternoon.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Skokomish River At Potlatch
* until Thursday afternoon.
* At  9:15 AM Monday the stage was 16.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 11 AM
Monday and crest near 17.6 feet around 10 PM Monday. The river will
fall slowly to below flood stage early Thursday morning.
* Impact...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate
flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some
residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the
Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley
road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
